sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} and B = {2, 3}. Find (AxB)ΔB and AΔ(BxB) where Δ represents the symmetric difference. Show that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to the symmetric difference.
